title: Recipes
text:
Preface
These are the recipes I like to use.
Key:
 Vegan
 Freezable
 Family recipe

title: 1  Tips and Tricks
text: 1.1 Conversions

title: 1  Tips and Tricks
text:

Substitution
Notes




100g SR flour
little less than 100g P flour + 1tsp BP
Mix well


1 egg
1/4 cup or 2.5oz apple sauce
Works in fruity, heavy cakes like carrot cake.


1 egg white
50ml aquafaba
Whips to stiff peaks. Used in mini rolls.

title: 1  Tips and Tricks
text:
1.3 Brownie method
Makes thick gloopy batter and nice gooey brownies.

Melt chocolate and butter slowly.
Stir in sugar and set aside.
Beat eggs in small jug with fork.
Well method to combine everything, just before going in the oven.

title: 1  Tips and Tricks
text:
1.4 Other notes

When using apple cider vinegar and BP in vegan cakes, once mixed get in oven quickly.
Chocolate chips work better than cut up chocolate in cookies (because way they melt?).

title: 2  Bread
text: 2.1 Basic Bread

title: 2  Bread
text:
500g bread flour
1/2tsp salt
1tsp yeast
1tsp sugar
1tbsp oil
325ml warm water





220C
35 mins
loaf

title: 2  Bread
text:
2.2 Focaccia  




500g bread flour
7g yeast
2 + 1.5 + 1 tbsp olive oil
salt
rosemary
350-400ml water





200C
25 mins
25x35”


Method


- Knead 5-10mins.
- Prove 1hr.
- Stretch to fit tin.
- Prove 45m.
- Dimple, add rosemary, drizzle with oil, 1tbsp water, salt.
- Bake.
- Drizzle with oil while hot.


Notes


- Half mix fits in 20cm square.

title: 2  Bread
text:
2.3 Fruit And Nut Rolls  




150g wholemeal bread flour
150g P flour
1tsp salt
1tsp yeast
1tsp brown sugar
1tsp oil
110g nuts
100g fruit





200C
15-20 mins
8


Method


- Combine flour, salt and yeast.
- Mix 200ml hot water with sugar and oil.
- Form dough and knead 5 mins.
- Press into 30cm square, scatter fruit and nuts, roll, cut, shape.
- Prove 1h 15m then bake.

title: 2  Bread
text:
2.4 Garlic Doughballs  




50g butter
300g white bread flour
7g yeast
1tbsp sugar
1tsp salt

Topping:
100g butter
1 garlic clove





160C
25-30 mins
30


Method


- Add butter to 175ml warm water first.
- Knead 5mins until bouncy and smooth.
- Prove 1.5-2 hours.
- Knock back and knead for several minutes.
- Roll into balls about 0.5cm apart.
- Prove 30mins.
- Bake then brush some of the butter and leave cool for 5 mins.

title: 2  Bread
text:
2.5 Pizza Dough 




1/2 tsp yeast
150ml warm water
1/4 tsp sugar
220g P flour
3/2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
1/3 tsp salt
semolina








Method


- Bloom yeast, water and sugar for 10mins -> bubble.
- Combine until shaggy dough.
- Knead 10-15min.
- Prove.
- Semolina under dough on baking tray.

title: 2  Bread
text:
2.6 Rolls  




500g bread flour
340ml water
4g yeast
8g salt
6g sugar





200C
16-18 mins
10


Method


- Bloom yeast.
- Gradually add dry.
- Knead 10mins.
- Turn and prove 1hr.
- Turn and prove 30mins.
- Roll balls and rest 5 mins.
- Shape into ovals.
- Prove 20mins.
- Bake.


Notes


- Add steam to oven.

title: 2  Bread
text:
2.7 Yeast-Raised No-Knead Flatbread 




500g P flour
7g yeast
360ml water
1tbsp oilve oil
1tbsp sugar
1tsp salt





12


Method


- Bloom yeast with olive oil.
- Add wet to dry and mix with spoon.
- Prove 30-60mins.
- Make balls then roll into flatbreads.
- Cook on skillet for 30 seconds (bubbles form on top).
- Flip and cook for another 30 seconds.


Notes


- Soft, tasty, good for gyros/falafels.
- Kept and reheated well.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.1 Almond Cookies
Method
- Mix sugar and ground almonds.
- Whisk aquafaba with fork until light, frothy and foamy, about 2 mins.
- Mix all together.
- Roll, then press slightly in flaked almonds, both sides
- Bake.
Notes
- Nice, but make them small since sweet and dry.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
60ml aquafaba
225g ground almonds
160g caster sugar
almond extract
flaked almonds





180C
13-15 mins
24

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.2 Bourbons 




200g butter
100g caster sugar
2tbsp cocoa
280g P flour

Filling:
75g butter
100g icing sugar
2tbsp custard powder
2tbsp cocoa powder
30g melted dark chocolate





160C
15-20 mins
30 x small sandwiches


Method


- Cream sugar and butter.
- Stir in dry and mix to dough.
- Chill 30mins.
- Roll to 0.5cm thick, cut, prick, bake. For filling, cream sugar and butter first.


Notes


- "Like a bourbon, but good!"
- Freezing changes the texture.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.3 Chocolate Chip Cookies  




125g (4.5 oz) marg
100g (3.5oz) light brown sugar
2tbsp syrup
vanilla
160g (5.5oz) SR flour
150g chocolate chips





180C
12 mins
21 x 29g balls


Method


- Combine, roll bake.


Notes


- Chopped chocolate changes texture of cookie, so try to use chips.
- 15 x 39g balls for bake sale size.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.4 Chocolate Crackle Tops 




7oz plain chocolate
3.5oz butter
4oz caster sugar
3 eggs
vanilla
7.5oz P flour
1oz cocoa
1/2tsp BP
pinch salt





160C
10-15 mins
22


Method


- Melt chocolate and butter.
- Mix, chill for 1 hr, roll in icing sugar, bake.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.5 Chocolate Fork Biscuits 




150g P flour
1tsp BP
70g caster sugar
125g marg
1tsp vanilla
20g cocoa
pinch salt





180C
15 mins


Method


- Cream sugar, marg, vanilla.
- Roll, fork, bake.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.6 Chocolate Orange Cookies 




125g butter
125g light brown sugar
75g caster sugar
50ml milk
1 orange zest
215g P flour
35g cocoa
1/2 tsp BP
1/4tsp B of S
1/4tsp salt
250g chocolate chips





180C
45640 mins


Method


- Cream, add wet, then dry, roll and bake.
- Leave to cool 10 mins on tray before moving.


Notes


- Soft.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.7 Coconut Cookies  




112g butter
200g caster sugar
1/2 tsp vanilla
156g P flour
1/2 tsp B of S
1/4tsp salt
106g coconut
4tbsp milk





180C
12 mins
20


Method


- As they bake, they spread a lot.
- Bake until edges firm and set, middle will still be soft but will firm when cooling.


Notes


- Chewy and coconutty.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.8 Coconut Oat Cookies 




100g brown sugar
115g margarine
3tbsp syrup
1tsp vanilla
145g oats
125g P flour
180g coconut
1tsp B of S
1/2 tsp cinnamon
1tbsp- milk





180C
15-18 mins
22


Method


- Melt sugar, marg, syrup.
- Roll, bake.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.9 Double Chocolate Cookies  




110g margarine
100g caster sugar
100g light brown sugar
1tsp vanilla
125g P flour
55g cocoa
1tsp BP
pinch salt
1tbsp milk
100g chocolate chips





180C
10 mins
20


Method


- Roll, chill, slightly flatten, bake.
- Optional to top with chips.


Notes


- Chewy, soft.
- Nice with 50-50 hazelnuts;chocolate chips.
- 15-16 x 40g balls for bake sale size.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.10 Double Chocolate Cookies




125g butter
175g light brown sugar
1 egg
175g SR flour
50g cocoa
100g chocolate chips





170C
12-15 mins
25


Method


- Cream until light and fluffy.
- Beat in eggs.
- Fold rest.
- Roll, chill, bake.


Notes


- Chewy and crisp.
- Nice with hazelnuts too.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.11 Gingerbread  




125g (4.5oz) marg
100g(3.5oz) dark brown sugar
4tbsp syrup
325g (11.5oz) P flour
1tsp B of S
2tsp ginger
1tsp cinnamon





170C
9-10m mins
17 x trees


Method


- Melt marg, sugar, syrup.
- Stir to a stiff dough.
- Roll, cut, chill, bake.


Notes


- Can bake dough from frozen, add couple more minutes.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.12 Hobnobs 




75g butter
75g caster sugar
1/2tbsp syrup
75g wholemeal flour
150g oats
1/2 tsp B of S





180C
10 mins
15


Method


- Beat butter and sugar.
- Mix in syrup.
- Add mixed dry to wet a bit at a time -> crumbly mix.
- Press mixture into a 6.5cm cookie cutter and compress
- Bake and spread.


Notes


- A bit too sweet, so needs that dark chocolate - could try reducing sugar?
- Used ~60g chocolate to cover.
- 2tbsp mix per biscuit.
- Like crumble mix.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.13 Lebkuchen  




7oz runny honey
3oz butter
7oz P flour
3.5oz ground almonds
1tsp BP
1/4tsp B of S
1.5tsp cinnamon
1.5tsp ginger
1tsp mixed spice
(0.5tsp nutmeg/allspice/..)
half zest and juice of orange
200g chocolate





180C
15 mins
18


Method


- Melt honey and butter, then cool 5 mins in fridge.
- Add remaining then chill for at least an hour.
- Roll with damp hands.
- Bake, cool, dip.


Notes


- "Like a jaffa cake".
- Used 108g chocolate to coat bottoms

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.14 Lemon Sandwich Biscuits




150g butter
1 lemon zest
85g caster sugar
1 egg yolk
280g P flour
1tbsp cornflour

Filling:
75g butter
130g icing sugar
2tbsp lemon curd





180C
14-16 mins
20 x sandwiches


Method


- Cream sugar, butter, zest 2-3 mins until pale and creamy.
- Beat in egg yolk 1 min.
- Mix in flour -> clumps.
- Bring to ball, roll to 3-4mm thick, chill at least an hour.
- Cut, bake.
- Beat buttercream 3-5mins until very pale and creamy before adding lemon curd.


Notes


- Can top with simple lemon icing.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.15 Nankhatai 




3 green cardamom pods
40g icing sugar
100g butter
70g SR flour
25g semolina
25g gram flour
pinch salt
almonds





140C
20 mins
24


Method


- Grind cardamom seeds with 1tsp icing sugar.
- Beat butter, sugar, cardamom until light and creamy about 10mins.
- Marble-sized balls.
- Flatten slightly with almond.
- Chill 20 mins before baking.


Notes


- Delicate flavour and light biscuit.

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.16 Oaty Chocolate Chip Cookies 




4oz marg
4oz light brown sugar
1 egg
1tsp vanilla
5oz SR flour
3oz oats
8oz choc chips





190C
15-20 mins
19

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.17 Shortbread   




8oz butter
8oz (icing sugar + cornflour)
8oz plain flour
demerara sugar





170C
15 mins
37 x 5.5cm

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.18 Triple Chocolate Cookies




200g butter
300g light brown sugar
vanilla
2 eggs
80g cocoa
300g SR flour
1tsp BP

180C

28

title: 3  Biscuits
text:
3.19 Viennese Biscuits  




250g butter
50g icing sugar
225g P flour
25g cornflour

Filling:
100g butter
200g icing sugar





170C
10-15 mins
30 x small whirls or 18 finger sandwiches


Method


- Lots beating to pale and fluffy.
- Then sieve flours and beat until well mixed.
- Pipe and bake.


Notes


- To make jam use 160g raspberries and 200g jam sugar.
- 100g dark chocolate to dip.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.1 Apple Crumble Cake
Method
- Make crumble topping and set aside.
- Cut apples into small pieces, about 0.75cm.
- Combine oil, vinegar and vanilla.
- Gradually mix in sugar.
- Add in milk and combine.
- Sift dry over wet in 2-3 batches.
- Stir in apples, top with crumble and bake.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
300g apples
100ml oil
175g light brown sugar
0.5tbsp apple cider vinegar
1/2 tbsp vanilla
240ml milk
250g plain flour
2 tsp cinnamon
0.5tsp ground cardamom
0.75 tsp BofS
1.5 tsp BP

Topping:
56g plain flour
31g sugar
44g butter





160C
45-50 mins
8” round

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.2 Banana Loaf 




3-4 (~11.5oz) bananas
3.5oz light brown sugar
10.5oz SR flour
3.5oz sultanas
1.75oz walnuts
1tsp mixed spice
1tsp BP
5floz oil





160C
55-60 mins
loaf

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.3 Carrot Cake  




6oz marg
6oz light brown sugar
3 eggs
4oz carrot
2oz raisins
2oz dates
1/2tsp cinnamon
1/4tsp nutmeg
1oz coconut
1oz walnuts
6oz wholemeal flour
pinch salt
1tsp BP





180C
90 mins
8” round


Notes


- For vegan option, replace eggs with 7.5oz apple puree and 1/2tsp BP, but may need to cook a little longer with foil on top.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.4 Chocolate And Caramel Cake




47.5g cocoa
120g light brown sugar
1tsp vanilla
87.5ml just boiled water
210g P flour
1/2 tsp BP
1/2 tsp B of S
125g butter
140 sugar
2 eggs

Filling:
150g sugar
150ml double cream
1/2 tsp vanilla
1tsp sea salt

Topping:
110g egg white (<3 eggs)
160g sugar
235g butter





160C
20-25 mins
2 x 8” round


Method


- Whisk cocoa, sugar, vanilla and water until smooth and leave cool 5 mins.
- Cream butter and sugar, 3-5 mins, then beat in eggs 1 at a time.
- Fold in dry 1/3 at a time, then cooled cocoa mixture.
- Bake.
- For caramel, sugar and 6tbsp water in saucepan over medium heat, cook 6-8 mins no stirring, until starts to turn deep amber.
- Remove from heat and place in bowl cold water.
- Slowly whisk in cream and vanilla -> thick pouring consistency (can stir over heat if necessary).
- Stir in salt and leave to cool.
- For buttercream, whisk egg whites and sugar until smooth.
- Place over pan of simmering water for 5mins, whisking occasionally until sugar dissolves - feels smooth, not grainy between fingertips.
- Whisk about 7mins to stiff peaks.
- Add butter and whisk about 5mins, until smooth and glossy - don't panic if appears to curdle, just keep whisking.
- Add vanilla and 5 tbsp cooled caramel, 1tbsp at a time and mix until smooth.


Notes


- Not too chocolately or too sweet.
- Buttercream very smooth and silky. Could do with less buttercream.
- Caramel sauce did not work as stated - hard lumps of sugar and had to heat slowly to get mix with cream - next time would not dunk in cold water, but would add warm cream instead.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.5 Chocolate And Sweet Potato Loaf




250 boiled sweet potato
100g plain chocolate
125 marg
150g light brown sugar
2 eggs
175g SR flour
1/2 tsp BP
75g chocolate chips

Topping:
100g plain chocolate
25g marg
2tbsp syrup

50-60 mins
loaf


Method


- Mash potato and chocolate together.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.6 Chocolate Cake 




400g caster sugar
100g cocoa
300g P flour
2tsp B of S
1tsp salt
500ml boiling water
125ml oil
1tbsp apple cider vinegar





180C
20-25 mins
2 x 8” round


Method


- Mix dry together.
- Quickly add wet.


Notes


- 1.25 mix makes large 9" cake.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.7 Devil’s Food Cake




2oz cocoa
6floz boiling water
6oz marg
12oz dark brown sugar
3 eggs
10oz P flour
3/2tsp B of S
1/4 tsp BP
4floz soured cream/buttermilk





180C
30-35 mins
9” round


Method


- Mix and cool cocoa and water.
- Cream marg, sugar and eggs.
- Sift dry twice.
- Add dry to creamed in 3 batches, alternating with dairy.


Notes


- Comes out a tall 2x8", think would be better to have 3x8".
- 150g cream/choc was enough ganache to fill and top 2x8", but not sides.

title: 4  Cakes
text:

8oz SR flour
1/2tsp B of S

4tbsp treacle

180C
45 mins
8” round

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.9 Ginger Cake 




350g P flour
225g dark brown sugar
2-3tsp ginger
1tsp BP
t/1tsp B of S
pinch salt

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.10 Lemon Cake 




295ml milk
10ml apple cider vinegar
120ml aquafaba
115g butter
120ml oil
300g sugar
1 tbsp lemon zest
1 tbsp lemon extract
1dsp vanilla
350g P flour
12g baking powder
3g salt
turmeric





175C
2 x 8” round


Method


- Combine milk and vinegar and sit aside for buttermilk.
- Mix aquafaba 1-2 mins high speed into light and foamy and set aside.
- Beat butter, oil, sugar and lemon zest 3 mins until light and fluffy.
- Mix in buttermilk and aquafaba.
- Fold in rest, do not overmix.


Notes


- Paired with buttercream with lemon zest.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.11 Loaves 




5oz marg
5oz caster
2 eggs
7oz SR flour
3tbs milk





180C
60 mins
loaf


Notes


- For Cherry & Almond add 4oz cherries and 2oz ground almond.
- For Lemon Drizzle add zest 2 lemons and use 4tbsp (juice and caster sugar) to drizzle.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.12 Marbled Chocolate And Orange




8oz mix
1tsp BP
zest 1-2 oranges
4tsp orange juice
2tbsp cocoa
4oz plain choc (melted)





180C
75 mins
8” round

title: 4  Cakes
text:

4oz SR flour
2oz ground almonds
5oz caster sugar
2eggs

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.14 Raspberry And White Chocolate Cake




8oz mix
100g white chocolate
175 raspberries

Filling:
200g white chocolate
250ml double cream





160C
20-25 mins
2 x 8” round


Method


- Melt butter and chocolate together, cool 2mins.
- Beat in eggs and sugar.
- Fold in flour and raspberries.


Notes


- Sweet.
- Raspberries sunk, but maybe because cooked as one big cake.
- Used oat cream for ganache, which was more like pouring cream, but still worked.

title: 4  Cakes
text:
4.15 Victoria Cake 




8oz mix
1tsp BP





180C
25-30 mins
2 x 8” round


Notes


- Or makes 20 fairy cakes or 16 cupcakes.

title: 5  Desserts and Confectionery
text:
5.1 Bakewell Tart
Method
- Shape pastry into disc and chill half an hour.
- Roll and line tart.
- Prick and freeze 20mins.
- Bake with beans 20mins, then without 10mins until pale golden then set aside.
- Whisk melted butter and sugar, then whisk in flours.
- Gradually whisk in aquafaba, then rest of frangipane.
- Assemble and bake 30-45mins.

title: 5  Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Pastry:
250g P flour
40g icing sugar
1/4tsp salt
150g butter

Filling:
80g melted butter
130g sugar
60g P flour
10g cornflour
90ml aquafaba
200g ground almonds
1tsp BP
1/2tsp almond extract
6tbsp raspberry jam

Topping:
150g raspberries
flaked almonds





180C

title: 5  Desserts and Confectionery
text:
5.2 Chocolate Fudge 




350g dark chocolate
370g vegan condensed milk
chopped nuts to decorate





20cm square


Method


- Melt over low heat, stirring occasionally until smooth and silky.
- Press into tin and chill for 1 hour or until set.


Notes


- Was ok, would be ok use of leftover condensed milk.
- One third of recipe in large glass clip tub was under 2cm thick.

title: 5  Desserts and Confectionery
text:
5.3 Chocolate Pudding 




67g sugar
11g cocoa
1.5tbsp cornstarch
305g milk
1tbsp butter
vanilla





3 dessert pots


Method


- Whisk sugar, cocoa and cornstarch until no lumps in a pan.
- Add milk and combine.
- Heat to simmer and whisk often.
- Simmer about 3 mins until slightly thickened and glossy.
- Remove from heat and whisk in butter and vanilla.
- Pour into dishes and chill overnight.


Notes


- Will thicken as it cools.
- Unsure about this recipe - was ok, but texture a bit odd.

title: 5  Desserts and Confectionery
text:
5.4 Chocolate Tart 




Base:
350g digestives
2tbsp cocoa
1tbsp P flour
1tbsp syrup
125g-175g butter

Filling:
2 x 400g cans coconut milk, chilled
200g dark chocolate
1tbsp syrup





180C
45577 mins
23cm tart


Method


- Crush biscuits, mix in rest and enough butter to create dough.
- Press into tin, bake and cool.
- Whisk melted chocolate, syrup and only thick coconut (discard water).
- Pour over base and set in fridge for 3-4 hours.


Notes


- Kept in fridge for few days.
- Nice with raspberries.

title: 5  Desserts and Confectionery
text:
5.5 Chocolate Truffles 




300g dark chocolate
240ml coconut cream
dessicated coconut





28


Notes


- Very soft - maybe coat in chocolate, or add nut in centre?

title: 6  Dinners
text:
6.1 Bean Burgers
Method
- Mash everything together, shape and freeze.

title: 6  Dinners
text:
400g black beans
300g sweet potato, mashed
black pepper
cumin
paprika
fresh coriander





8

title: 6  Dinners
text:
6.2 Falafel  




16oz dried chickpeas
1/2tsp B of S
1 small onion
1/4 cup parsley
3-5 cloves garlic
3/2 tbs gram flour
1.75 tsp salt
2tsp cumin
1tsp ground coriander
1/4tsp black pepper
1/4tsp cayenne pepper
pinch cardamom
1tsp BP
oil for frying





182-190C


Method


- Soak chickpeas in water and B of S 12-24 hours.
- Drain and rinse well.
- Food process everything until rough, coarse meal forms - between couscous and paste.
- Refrigerate 1-2 hours.
- Shape into balls - will stick together loosely at first, but will bind once begin to fry.
- If won't bind, try processor again to make more paste-like.
- If stil not, try adding flour.
- Fry 2-3 mins per side.


Notes


- 9.5oz chickpeas made enough for 5 people.
- Can freeze cooked falafel and reheat in oven from frozen, but not the same.

title: 6  Dinners
text:
6.3 Toad-In-Hole




70g P flour
1 egg
87.5ml milk
seasoning





200C
25-30 mins
Small glass square dish


Method


- Cook 3 sausages in oil in oven.
- Make batter and leave to stand until sausages ready.
- Pour batter into hot dish and cook until risen and golden.


Notes


- Can use oat milk.

title: 7  Extras
text:
7.1 Buttercream
Method
- Add icing sugar and little milk to make stiffer or more spreadable.
Notes
- Can add vanilla, peppermint, ...
- Can replace small amount of icing sugar with cocoa.
- For 8" victoria, try 60g butter, 120g icing sugar.

title: 7  Extras
text:
1 butter
1-2 icing sugar

title: 7  Extras
text:
7.2 Chocolate Ganache




100g plain/white chocolate
100ml double cream








Method


- Heat cream, pour over, sit, whisk 10 mins or chill slightly.

title: 7  Extras
text:
7.3 Lemon Curd 




120ml milk
61ml lemon juice
1tbsp lemon zest
100g granulated sugar
1tbsp cornstarch
1tbsp butter
turmeric








Method


- Whisk over medium heat until thickens, about 5-10 mins.


Notes


- Will thicken a bit as it cools.
- Half this is enough for lemon sandwich biscuits.

- Sieve dry twice, then muffin method.

title: 9  Pancakes and Scones
text:
9.1 Classic Scones
Method
- Mix dry.
- Rub in butter to breadcrumbs.
- Stir in sugar (and fruit).
- Warm milk about 30seconds then add vanilla and lemon and set aside for a moment.
- Heat baking tray.
- Add wet to dry well and combine quickly with knife.
- Tip onto floured surface, dredge with flour and fold over 2-3 times.
- Pat into about 4cm high, cut, glaze, bake.

6 x 7.8cm or 14 x 5.8cm

- Make pastry, line tin, chill 15 mins.

- Bake 10-15 ins without beans and leave to cool.

title: 11  Traybakes
text:
11.3 Brownies  




250g dark chocolate
100ml oil
200ml milk
1tsp vanilla
175g P flour
50g cocoa
150g light brown sugar
1/2tsp salt
200g choc chips





160C
20-25 mins
9” square


Method


- Melt chocolate slowly.
- Whisk in wet.
- Fold in mixed dry.
- Cool in tin, then in fridge for few hours before cutting.


Notes


- Very rich and dark, so cut very small (40).
- Maybe try with lighter chocolate and/or a little BP?

- Melt butter, sugar, milk gently until dissolves.
- Boil briskly 3 mins.
- Stir in icing sugar, beat and spread quickly.

title: 11  Traybakes
text:
11.9 Lemon Bars 




Base:
6oz P flour
4oz marg
2oz caster sugar

Filling:
200g caster sugar
25g P flour
pinch salt
3 eggs
3 lemon zest
200ml lemon juice (3-4 lemons)





160-180C
25-35 mins
8” square


Method


- Bake shortbread at 180 for 15-20mins.
- Whisk filling together while base is cooling, pour over and bake at 160 for 10-15 mins (until top is just set).
- Dust with icing sugar.

title: 11  Traybakes
text:
11.10 Lemon Bars 




Base:
use shortbread base from other recipe

Filling:
177ml lemon juice (about 4 large lemons)
Optional 2tsp lemon zest
300g caster sugar
296 coconut milk - mostly the thick part
6tbs cornflour
pinch turmeric





180C
15 mins
8” square


Method


- Bake base.
- Whisk filling ingredients well and heat over medium heat until sugar dissolves and mixture thickens.
- Spread over base and bake.
- Chill 1-2 hours or overnight until set.


Notes


- Nice, very lemony/tart, did not use zest

title: 11  Traybakes
text:
11.11 Peppermint Mini Rolls 




150ml aquafaba
100g caster sugar
80g P flour
2tbsp cocoa
1/2tsp BP
1/4 tsp vanilla

Filling:
125g butter
125g icing sugar
1tsp milk
few drops peppermint extract





24 x 32 cm


Method


- Whip aquafaba to almost stiff peaks.
- Add sugar in spoonful at a time, whilst whipping to stiff.
- Add whites to dry ingredients in 2 alternating lots.
- Spread in tim and bake 5 mins at 220, then 5-10mins at 180.
- Cool 2mins, roll, then leave to cool.
- Spread filling, roll and chill 30mins.
- Coat in 180g chocolate and chill to set.


Notes


- Very tasty.
- Aquafaba whipping can take 15mins+.
- Original recipe uses 3 eggs instead.
- Reddit tips https:;//www.reddit.com/r/AskBaking/comments/lzpyg8/swiss_roll_disaster_rubbery_bottom_what_did_do/

title: 11  Traybakes
text:
11.12 Raspberry And White Chocolate Blondies




140g (5-oz) white chocolate
75g (2.6oz) marg
100g (3.5oz) caster sugar
2 eggs
vanilla
pinch salt
125g (4.5-oz) P flour
1box raspberries





180C
17-20 mins
8” square

title: 11  Traybakes
text:
11.13 Twix 




Base:
300g P flour
10g caster sugar
200g butter
1tsp vanilla

Filling:
640g vegan condensed milk
270g butter
100g light brown sugar

Topping:
250g chocolate





180C
30 mins
8” square


Method


- Bake shortbread until lightly golden then leave to cool.
- Place all filling ingredients over low-medium heat until turn amber, stirring all the time - takes 15-20mins to reach firm ball stage.
- Pour over base and chill 3-4hrs until set.


Notes


- Softer and chewier than caramel shortbread - more like twix.
